fields.title: conditional probability
fields.pointers:
* It is also possible to condition on random variables, i.e. define a  [conditional distribution](conditional_distributions)  of one random variable given another.
*  [Bayes' rule](bayes_rule)  is a method for combining prior beliefs with evidence which follows directly from the definition of conditional probability.  [ (go to concept)](bayes_rule)
* Two events are  [independent](independence)  if the conditional probability of one event doesn't depend on the other event.
fields.summary: The conditional probability of an event A given another event B is the probability that A occurs if it's known that B occurs. Conditional probability is fundamental to probabilistic modeling, since it gives a way of accounting for observed evidence.
